meanings.definition: Formally put an end to (a system, practice, or institution)
meanings.sent1: The king abolished the old rule.
meanings.sent2: The government abolished the outdated policy.
meanings.sent3: The magician waved his wand and abolished the trick forever.
meanings.sent4: With a single stroke, she abolished all doubts from their minds.
meanings.sent5: The hero's sacrifice finally abolished the evil curse.

meanings.definition: Do away with (a law, custom, or institution)
meanings.sent1: The council abolished the ancient tradition.
meanings.sent2: The committee decided to abolish the outdated regulation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he wished to abolish Mondays.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could abolish any tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The new technology could abolish the need for paper entirely.
